briefTitle: Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety of Pulmicort Respules in Japanese Adult Asthmatic Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Provision of informed consent prior to any study specific procedures.
* A minimum of 6 months documented history of asthma according to the JGL 2006 definition
* Asthma patients under prescribed treatment with ICS at least 3 months before Visit 2.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Current or previous tobacco smokers with a history of \>= 10 pack-years
* Use of Î²-blockers including eye drops
* Clinically significant respiratory infection affecting the asthma, as judged by the investigator(s) within 4 weeks prior to visit 2
* Intake of oral, rectal or parenteral GCS within 4 weeks prior to Visit 2

outcomeMeasures.title: Morning Peak Expiratory Flow (mPEF)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in morning peak expiratory flow (mPEF) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Evening Peak Expiratory Flow (ePEF)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in evening peak expiratory flow (ePEF) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Asthma Symptom Score (Daytime); Score of 0-3 (0 = no Asthma Symptoms - 3 = Severe Symptoms)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Asthma symptom score (Daytime) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Asthma Symptom Score (Night-time); Score of 0-3 (0 = no Asthma Symptoms - 3 = Severe Symptoms)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Asthma symptom score (Night-time) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Asthma Symptom Score (Total); Score of 0-3 (0 = no Asthma Symptoms - 3 = Severe Symptoms)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Asthma symptom score (Total) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Use of Rescue Medication (Daytime)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Use of rescue medication (Daytime) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Use of Rescue Medication (Night-time)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Use of rescue medication (Night-time) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Use of Rescue Medication (Total)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Use of rescue medication (Total) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Night-time Awakenings Due to Asthma Symptoms
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Night-time awakenings due to asthma symptoms from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 Second (FEV 1.0)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV 1.0) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Forced Vital Capacity (FVC)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) from baseline (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Turbuhaler) to Week 6 (mean of the last 14 days of the period on Pulmicort Respules)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: Number of participants with AEs reported during the period on Pulmicort Respules
